173.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested by Thane Police on March 13 for allegedly murdering the father of his girlfriend for denying his marriage request. After the victim, Kamaljit Sande, denied the proposal, the accused, Pappukumar Shah, assured him he would respect his wish. However, on March 4, Shah took Sande out for a party and slit his throat.

174.title: Man accused of gangraping 16-yr-old girl & filming the act shot dead in Assam encounter
174.article_body: The prime accused in the case involving gangraping and filming a 16-year-old girl in Assam was shot dead in a police encounter when he allegedly tried to escape from custody after attacking a police team. Guwahati Medical College Hospital superintendent Abhijit Sarma said the accused, Biki Ali, sustained four injury marks, one in the chest and three in the back.

175.title: Joe Biden mistakenly calls Kamala Harris 'First Lady of the US'
175.article_body: US President Joe Biden mistakenly called Vice President Kamala Harris the "First Lady of the US" at an event. Biden made the gaffe when he was explaining that Harris would not attend the event because her husband, Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff, had contracted COVID-19. "I'm Joe Biden. I'm Jill Biden's husband and proud of it," Biden later joked.

176.title: Didn't want to do Saazish; hoped Saira would say no but she agreed: Dharmendra
176.article_body: Dharmendra shared a song from his and Saira Banu's 1975 film 'Saazish'. He said he didn't want to do the movie and hoped Saira would say no to the film but she agreed. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "I asked the producer to go and sign Saira, [it was] difficult to sign her those days. But Saira happily agreed."

177.title: Pune airport to get new terminal building at ₹475 cr by August 2023
177.article_body: The Pune airport is expected to get a new terminal building with enhanced capacity by August 2023. The construction work has been undertaken by the Airports Authority of India at a cost of ₹475 crore. The new and old terminal will have a passenger handling capacity of 1.6 crore passengers per annum.

178.title: Honest probe will identify culprits: Farooq on 'The Kashmir Files'
178.article_body: Reacting to the movie 'The Kashmir Files', ex-J&K CM Farooq Abdullah said that an honest investigation should be held to find out the culprits and the reason why such an incident occurred in the valley. He said, "Every film portrays...story in a unique way...It's important...the film portrays exact truth." The movie depicts the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits from the valley.

179.title: Fan comes up with 'Bachchhan Paandey' themed Holi colours, pics surface
179.article_body: A gulaal manufacturer from Lucknow, who is also a fan of actor Akshay Kumar, has come up with a "special edition" of Holi colours based on the film 'Bachchhan Paandey'. The packets of gulaal have a picture of Akshay from the movie with "Holi Ke Rang, Bachchhan Paandey ke sang" written on them. Holi will be celebrated on March 18.

180.title: Man claims hijab-wearing wife denied train seat, Mumbai Police chief says, 'Ridiculous'
180.article_body: A man, Dr Parvez Mandviwala, tweeted on Wednesday that his wife was denied a seat on a local train in Mumbai as she was wearing a hijab. Replying to the news report, Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey tweeted, "This is ridiculous." Mandviwala claimed few passengers insisted that saree-clad women get seated despite the fact that her wife carried their infant.

181.title: A proud moment: Viswanathan Anand on Chennai hosting 44th Chess Olympiad
181.article_body: Five-time world chess champion Viswanathan Anand said it's a proud moment for all Indians that Chennai has been chosen to host the 44th Chess Olympiad. The Olympiad was scheduled to take place in Moscow but was shifted amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Chennai warmly welcomes all Kings and Queens from around the world!" tweeted Tamil Nadu CM M K Stalin.

182.title: Pune to host conclave on alternate fuel from April 2
182.article_body: Pune will host an alternate fuel conclave from April 2 to April 5, Maharashtra government has announced. The 'Pune Alternate Fuel Conclave' is in line with the state government's policy towards accelerated adoption of e-vehicles, which government announced in 2021. "We need to act now to preserve our environment. New mobility is...very important," state Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray said.

183.title: Punjab di aan, baan, shaan: AAP after Bhagwant Mann takes oath as CM
183.article_body: After Bhagwant Mann took oath as the Chief Minister of Punjab on Wednesday, the AAP described him as "Punjab di aan, baan aur shaan". The swearing-in ceremony was held at  Khatkar Kalan, which is the ancestral village of Bhagat Singh. The AAP supporters wore 'basanti' turbans and dupattas at the ceremony.

184.title: Russian soldiers appear to be surviving on just potatoes, onions & pickles, claims video
184.article_body: Russia's army appear to be surviving on just three ingredients after Ukrainian troops seized a battlefield kitchen, according to reports. Video taken by Ukrainian troops shows an armoured vehicle fitted with a professional kitchen onboard. Its cupboards were stocked with just onions, potatoes and jars of pickles, according to the clip which was posted on Reddit.

185.title: Forcing male organ into vagina while victim is wearing underpants is rape: High Court
185.article_body: Meghalaya High Court held that if a man forced his male "organ into the vagina or urethra of victim despite the victim wearing her underpants", it'd amount to penetration for the purpose of Section 375(b), IPC. The court was hearing a case where a minor in 2006 complained the accused didn't penetrate but rubbed from the top of her underwear.

186.title: Will give internships, stipends: Mamata to students who returned from Ukraine
186.article_body: West Bengal will allow the medical students who returned from war-torn Ukraine to start internship at government medical colleges, said CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday. They will also be given stipends, she added. "For engineering students, the West Bengal government will arrange education in the state at nominal cost," she added while interacting with the students.

187.title: End Facebook, other social media giants' interference in India's democracy: Sonia
187.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Wednesday urged the government to put an end to the alleged "systematic influence and interference of Facebook and other social media giants in India's electoral politics." She also referred to a recent report published in Al Jazeera that claimed that election advertisements on Facebook promoted BJP more as compared to other political parties.

188.title: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma briefly loses billionaire status
188.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma briefly fell off the list of billionaires on Wednesday, according to Forbes' data, amid volatility in the stock's price movement. The stock recovered some losses on Wednesday after falling 70% below its IPO price in four months. Sharma's current net worth stands at $1.1 billion, as per Forbes' real-time data.

189.title: Tesla stops China plant production for 2 days amid COVID-19 curbs: Report
189.article_body: Tesla has halted production at its Shanghai factory for two days, without giving a reason, amid the COVID-19 restrictions in China to curb the country's latest outbreak, Reuters reported citing an internal notice. The factory staff were told the production would be suspended for Wednesday and Thursday. It delivered 56,515 vehicles in February, including 33,315 for export.

190.title: Auto driver murdered after a bar fight in Bengaluru; 2 arrested
190.article_body: A 32-year-old auto driver was allegedly bludgeoned to death by two people with a cement brick on Tuesday after a bar fight in Bengaluru. The accused had reportedly chased the victim for 500 metres, beat him with an iron rod and tube lights before bludgeoning him to death. The duo, who'd fled the scene, has been arrested by the police.

191.title: Tata Communications becomes Formula 1's official broadcast connectivity provider
191.article_body: Formula 1 and Tata Communications on Wednesday announced a multi-year strategic collaboration under which Tata will be F1's official broadcast connectivity provider. Tata Communications will facilitate transfer of over 100 video feeds and 250 audio channels from the racetrack to F1's Media & Technology Centre in the UK. F1 and Tata had ended their eight-year marketing partnership in January 2020.

192.title: Kerala Assembly passes unanimous resolution against LIC IPO
192.article_body: The Kerala Legislative Assembly on Wednesday passed a unanimous resolution against the Centre's decision to sell its stakes in insurance company LIC. The resolution, which was moved by Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan, urged the Centre to retain its stake in the institution. Vijayan recalled that LIC was nationalised with an aim to protect stakeholders from the exploitation of private companies.

193.title: Taiwan using the Ukraine issue to validate their existence: China
193.article_body: China said Taiwan was "using the Ukraine issue to validate their existence and piggyback on a hot issue, taking advantage of other's difficulties". "Their attempts to incite confrontation, create hostility through political manipulation will not succeed," China's Taiwan Affairs Office spokeswoman Zhu Fenglian said. Taiwan has announced humanitarian aid for Ukraine and imposed sanctions on Russia.

194.title: Journalist shot dead in Mexico; 8th to be killed this year
194.article_body: A journalist working with Monitor Michoacan was shot dead on Tuesday in Mexico's Zitacuaro town. Armando Linares was the eighth journalist to be killed in the country this year. This comes weeks after Roberto Toledo, another journalist working with the same news outlet, was killed. Notably, Linares was the one to announce Toledo's death in a social media post.

195.title: I pray God gives courage to AAP to make prosperous Punjab: Gurdas Maan
195.article_body: Punjabi singer Gurdas Maan attended Punjab CM designate Bhagwant Mann's swearing-in ceremony on Wednesday and said that the Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) ideology is special. "It's (AAP winning 92 seats in Punjab Assembly elections) just a beginning...I pray that God gives them (AAP) courage to make prosperous Punjab," Gurdas Maan added.

196.title: Anupam Mittal meets R Madhavan and Chetan Bhagat, shares picture
196.article_body: Shaadi.com founder and Shark Tank India fame Anupam Mittal took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with actor R Madhavan and author Chetan Bhagat. "After lot of time...an intimate evening with a few friends over weekend...made me feel that things are finally returning back to 'normal' after...2 years. Hope I am right @anusha_bhagat thanks for hospitality," he wrote.

197.title: Father, daughter killed, 21 others injured in crash in Muzaffarnagar
197.article_body: A man and his 10-year-old daughter were killed while 21 others were injured following a collision in UP's Muzaffarnagar on Wednesday, police said. The incident occurred when a pick-up truck carrying the group of labourers was hit by another speeding truck near a village under Phugana police station, DSP Sharad Sharma said, adding, the injured labourers are in critical condition.

198.title: It's an honour to play alongside Jhulan Goswami: Mithali Raj
198.article_body: India Women captain Mithali Raj has said it's an honour to play alongside pacer Jhulan Goswami, who has become the first-ever woman bowler to claim 250 wickets in ODI cricket history. "It's difficult for any bowler to play at this level consistently," Mithali stated. Notably, Goswami is the only woman bowler to have over 200 wickets in ODIs.

199.title: 77 militants killed during infiltration attempts from Pak in 2021: Govt
199.article_body: Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Tuesday said a total of 77 militants were killed and 12 arrested while trying to infiltrate India from Pakistan in 2021. Moreover, 42 security force personnel died and 117 were injured in terror violence last year. Attempts of infiltration mainly took place in Jammu and Kashmir, he added.

200.title: Wish you had posted full video, not half-truth: Anupam to Kapil on invitation row
200.article_body: Anupam Kher reacted to Kapil Sharma thanking him for clarifying "false allegations" that he didn't invite 'The Kashmir Files' team to his show for not having a "big commercial star". Anupam wrote, "I wish you posted full video...not the half-truth." Anupam was referring to the video wherein he said Vivek Agnihotri was given "different reasons" for not inviting them.

201.title: It hasn't been easy mentally, it's crazy: Kylie on postpartum life
201.article_body: Kylie Jenner in a video said postpartum life since welcoming son Wolf "hasn't been easy" but rather "crazy". "I just want to say to my postpartum moms that postpartum hasn't been easy...it's...hard. This experience for me, personally, has been a little harder than with my daughter," she added. Kylie further assured her followers that it's "ok not to be ok".

202.title: Russia seeks 13-year-jail term for Putin critic Alexei Navalny
202.article_body: Russian prosecutors on Tuesday asked a court to sentence President Vladimir Putin's critic Alexei Navalny to 13 years in a maximum security prison on charges of embezzlement and contempt of court. Navalny is already serving a two-and-a-half-year sentence for parole violations at the prison colony. The prosecution request comes after Navalny urged Russians to protest the war in Ukraine.

203.title: Air travel may get costlier as ATF prices hit all-time highs after 18% hike
203.article_body: Air travel may get costlier as aviation turbine fuel (ATF) prices were hiked by over 18%, the steepest ever increase, to all-time high levels on Wednesday. The prices crossed the ₹1-lakh-per-kilolitre mark for the first time ever after the sixth straight hike this year. Jet fuel makes up for almost 40% of the running cost of an airline.

204.title: White House mocks Russia for sanctioning Biden's father, says 'may he rest in peace'
204.article_body: White House press secretary Jen Psaki mocked Russia by saying that its retaliatory sanctions may have actually targeted US President Joe Biden's late father. "President Biden is a junior," Psaki told reporters, adding may his father "rest in peace". Russian government had omitted the junior suffix from his legal name, but later clarified that sanctions targeted "President J Biden".

205.title: 500 people taken hostage by Russia at Ukraine hospital; being used as 'human shields'
205.article_body: Russian troops seized control of a hospital in the city of Mariupol and are holding about 500 people hostage, according to regional leader Pavlo Kyrylenko. He alleged the hostages were being used as human shields. "It's impossible to leave the hospital, they are shooting hard," Kyrylenko said.

206.title: Cats evolved from 42 million-yr-old sabre-toothed predators: Research
206.article_body: According to research, cats have evolved from hypercarnivore, sabre-toothed predators that lived 42 million years ago in North America. They were among the first mammals to have an exclusively meat-based diet. The species was double in size of an average house cat and was fierce enough to take down animals such as rhinoceroses, camels, tapirs, pigs and horses.

207.title: Bhagwant Mann sworn in as Chief Minister of Punjab
207.article_body: Bhagwant Mann was on Wednesday sworn in as the Chief Minister of Punjab at Khatkar Kalan, the ancestral village of freedom fighter Bhagat Singh. Delhi Chief Minister and Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal and other senior party leaders were present at the oath taking ceremony. The Aam Aadmi Party won 92 seats in the 117-seat Punjab Assembly.

208.title: India's accidentally fired missile nearly led to Pakistan retaliation: Report
208.article_body: An accidental missile fired by India last week nearly led to Pakistan retaliation, a report quoting people familiar with the matter said. Pakistan had prepared to launch a similar missile to strike India but held back because an initial assessment indicated something was amiss, the report added. India had said, "Technical malfunction led to accidental firing."

209.title: 90% of Ukrainians could face poverty if war drags on, warns UNDP
209.article_body: The UN Development Programme has warned that 90% of the Ukrainians could face poverty and extreme economic vulnerability if the Russia-Ukraine war drags on to next year. "We estimate that up to 18 years of development gains of Ukraine could simply be wiped out in a matter of 12 to 18 months," said UNDP Administrator Achim Steiner.

210.title: Polly is home: MI as Kieron Pollard arrives in Mumbai ahead of IPL 2022
210.article_body: MI took to their social media handles to announce the arrival of all-rounder Kieron Pollard in Mumbai ahead of the IPL season. "Polly is home and we can't control our excitement!" wrote MI.  Ishan Kishan, Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah have already joined the team's pre-season camp. MI will play their opening game against DC on March 27.

211.title: Avoided it, stories part of our sad reality: Gireesh on taking up Crime Patrol
211.article_body: Television actor Gireesh Sahdev, who will be playing SHO Ajit Singh in Crime Patrol 2.0, said that he avoided the show for the longest time. "When they tweaked the format...it absolutely fitted my bill...the stories told in the show are all true and very much part of the sad reality happening around us...that was more the reason," he added.

212.title: Akhilesh congratulates Punjab CM-designate ahead of swearing-in ceremony
212.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday congratulated CM-designate of Punjab, Bhagwant Mann, ahead of his oath-taking ceremony. "Many congratulations and best wishes to the newly elected CM of Punjab Bhagwant Mannji for the oath ceremony! Hope that under his able leadership, the crops of progress, brotherhood and new perspective will flourish in Punjab," Yadav tweeted.

213.title: Odisha govt declares dry day in state for urban polls from March 22
213.article_body: The Odisha government on Tuesday declared 'dry day' for five days from March 22 in view of the urban polls to be held on March 24. According to the letter, district magistrates and collectors have been ordered to ensure no liquor is sold or distributed by hotels or shops within polling areas from 5 pm of March 22 to 26.

214.title: HP govt to start batch-wise recruitment for JBT posts: CM Jairam Thakur
214.article_body: Himachal Pradesh government will soon begin batch-wise recruitment on vacant Junior Basic Training (JBT) posts in educational institutions, CM Jairam Thakur said on Tuesday. This will provide employment opportunities for trained youths, he said. Further, designations of BEd and TET qualified and eligible Shastri and language teachers would be changed to TGT (Sanskrit) and TGT (Hindi), he added.

215.title: Russian Prez Putin a 'war criminal': US Senate
215.article_body: The US Senate unanimously passed a resolution condemning Russian President Vladimir Putin as a "war criminal". The resolution called on the International Criminal Court to probe war crimes being carried out by Russia's military and Putin in Ukraine. "Putin cannot escape accountability for the atrocities committed against the Ukrainian people," Democratic Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said.

216.title: Pfizer asks US to allow 4th COVID-19 vaccine dose for people over 65
216.article_body: Pharma major Pfizer has sought approval for administering a fourth COVID-19 vaccine dose to people aged 65 and above in US. Pfizer and its German partner BioNTech cited data from Israel, where people aged over 60 are getting a second booster shot, to suggest that it would benefit the elderly. One booster is not good enough against infections, said Pfizer.

217.title: Actor Arslan Goni sustains eye injury after he slips on snow in Turkey
217.article_body: Arslan Goni was recently injured during the shoot of his film 'Love Ek Tarfa' in Turkey. While he was already nursing a nose injury, he, unfortunately, met with another accident. The actor slipped on snow and ended up with a bruised eye and other injuries on his face. On being contacted, Arslan confirmed getting hurt and said he's recovering well.

218.title: It didn't go our way despite batting first: Mithali on 2nd loss in Women's WC
218.article_body: India Women captain Mithali Raj said they need to work "very hard" on their batting in the upcoming games in the  Women's World Cup. "It didn't go our way despite getting what we wanted after losing toss," said Mithali after England chased down their 134-run total in 31.2 overs. "It's a relief, to be honest," said England captain Heather Knight.

219.title: Pat Cummins uses hammer to fix uneven Pakistani pitch, video goes viral
219.article_body: Australia Test captain Pat Cummins used a hammer to fix uneven pitch during the second Test against Pakistan in Karachi. The Pakistan Cricket Board took to Twitter to share a video, writing, "So Cummins is Thor?" A Twitter user commented, "For a change he is hammering the pitch and not batters."

220.title: Unfortunate but have to deal with it: Akshay on 'Bachchhan...' & RRR clash
220.article_body: When asked if the release of 'RRR' will affect the box office collection of 'Bachchhan Paandey', actor Akshay Kumar said, "Yes it obviously will, it's going to impact. Every movie is going to impact each other...The businesses are going to go down by 30% to 40%." "It's a very unfortunate thing but you have to deal with it," he added.

221.title: Golden rays of sun bring a new dawn: Punjab CM-designate Bhagwant Mann
221.article_body: Ahead of being sworn in as Punjab CM on Wednesday, AAP leader Bhagwant Mann said that "golden rays of the sun" herald a new dawn for Punjab. "To realise the dreams of Shaheed Bhagat Singh and Baba Saheb, the whole of Punjab will take oath today at Khatkar Kalan," Mann tweeted today morning.

222.title: Tewari shares invite for Mann's oath ceremony; says 'wasn't invited for Channi's oath'
222.article_body: Senior Congress leader Manish Tewari has shared invite for Bhagwant Mann's swearing-in ceremony on Twitter. "I thank him for inviting me to his swearing-in. Due to Parliament being in session I will not be able to make it," he tweeted. "It is ironic I was not invited to Charanjit Channi's swearing-in though he was one of my MLAs," Tewari wrote.

223.title: Wouldn't it just be kickass: Ranveer on working with Ranbir in a film
223.article_body: Responding to a query from a fan on Instagram about working with Ranbir Kapoor in a film, Ranveer Singh said, "I have been trying for years. Wouldn't it just be kickass." "Manifest it," added Ranveer when asked about him and Shah Rukh Khan being seen together onscreen. Ranveer was recently named Best Actor at Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival Awards.

224.title: Biker held for snatching woman's purse from auto-rickshaw in Mumbai
224.article_body: A 32-year-old motorcycle-borne man was arrested by Oshiwara Police in Mumbai on Tuesday for allegedly snatching a woman's purse who was travelling in an auto-rickshaw and fleeing the spot. The incident took place near Shikhar Tower in a lane next to the Indian Oil petrol pump on March 7. The police traced the accused using CCTV cameras in the vicinity.

225.title: India drop to 3rd place on Women's World Cup points table as England post 1st win
225.article_body: India have dropped to the third place on 2022 Women's World Cup points table after suffering their second defeat in the tournament on Wednesday. England defeated India by four wickets to register their first victory in the tournament. England are now sixth on the points table which is led by Australia, who have won each of their first four matches.

226.title: I would like SRH to have a bit of a storyline: Batting coach Lara
226.article_body: SRH's strategic advisor and batting coach Brian Lara said, "I would like us to have a bit of a storyline where we go out as a team and the openers have a particular job." "In the nets a lot of aggression is pretty cool, but in the middle I would like to see it mixed with...thinking upstairs," added Lara.

227.title: Goibibo announces Holi giveaway of ₹150 crore free goCash
227.article_body: Aiming to make the festival of Holi a 'Full Vasool' celebration, Goibibo is giving away ₹150 crore goCash. 75 lakh customers will get a part of it for free. Additionally, Goibibo has many more 'Holi Super Deals' on the app such as Daily Steal Deals and bank offers, seeking to make sure every customer gets to travel this Holi weekend.

228.title: Amazon's $8.5-billion MGM deal cleared by EU antitrust regulator
228.article_body: The European Union's antitrust regulator has approved Amazon's proposed $8.5-billion acquisition of MGM Studios after concluding that the transaction "won't raise competition concerns" in Europe. Their combined market shares are low and they have strong rivals, the regulator noted. The deal, which is Amazon's second-biggest acquisition, is still pending approval by the US Federal Trade Commission.

229.title: Nursing intern assaulted for talking to woman colleague in Gurugram
229.article_body: Three people have been booked for allegedly abducting and assaulting a 19-year-old nursing intern in Gurugram for talking to a woman colleague. Police said that the accused allegedly barged into a private hospital and abducted the victim Sahil Khan. Police also said the woman was allegedly ignoring another man, Naresh Yadav, after which Yadav and his associates abducted Sahil.

230.title: 2 women arrested for stealing gold ring from jewellery shop in Pune
230.article_body: A 21-year-old woman and a 20-year-old woman were arrested on Tuesday for allegedly stealing a gold ring from a jewellery shop in Pune's Sahakarnagar area. The duo had entered the shop pretending to be customers, according to an FIR. The police have also recovered a bike from their possession, which they had reportedly stolen from the Hirabaug area.

231.title: After going unsold in mega auction, Suresh Raina to commentate in IPL 2022
231.article_body: Suresh Raina, who had gone unsold in the IPL mega auction, will be a part of the Hindi commentary team for the upcoming edition of IPL. Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri will also be a part of the Hindi commentary team for IPL 2022. IPL 2022 will begin on March 26 with KKR facing CSK in the opener.

232.title: I'd punish myself for eating in my 20s; I was quite horrible: Jacqueline
232.article_body: During an interaction with actress Shilpa Shetty, actress Jacqueline Fernandez said she didn't know how to handle the pressure of being on an international platform. Jacqueline added she'd punish herself for eating. "In my 20s I did go through...lot of eating issues...It happened because of my pageant days...I didn't know how to handle it. Food became the enemy," she added.

233.title: 25-year-old Saqib Mahmood to make Test debut for England against WI
233.article_body: Pacer Saqib Mahmood is set to make his Test debut for England in the second Test against West Indies after Mark Wood was ruled out due to an elbow injury he suffered in the first Test. The 25-year-old right-arm pacer has played seven ODIs and 12 T20Is, picking a total of 21 wickets. The first Test had ended in draw.

234.title: 3 terrorists killed in encounter in Srinagar's Nowgam: J&K police
234.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir police on Wednesday said that they killed three unidentified terrorists in the Nowgam area of Srinagar. They said that the encounter broke out after the militants opened fire on the security forces during a search operation in the area based on intelligence. "Incriminating materials including arms and ammunition were recovered," they added.

235.title: Bhagwant Mann's daughter and son reach India to attend his swearing-in ceremony
235.article_body: The daughter and son of Aam Aadmi Party leader Bhagwant Mann have reached India from the US to attend his swearing-in ceremony in Punjab's Khatkar Kalan. Mann will take oath as Punjab CM today at the ancestral village of freedom fighter Bhagat Singh. Inderpreet Kaur, who separated from Mann in 2015, said that Mann was always in her prayers.

236.title: 7-yr-old kidnapped for 'human sacrifice' on Holi by UP man wanting to get married
236.article_body: A seven-year-old girl was kidnapped from Uttar Pradesh's Noida by her neighbour for "human sacrifice" on Holi. The girl's neighbour, who was finding it hard to get married, had consulted an occultist, who suggested him the method to please the gods in order to get married. The occultist has been identified but is at large, the police said.

237.title: Ukraine Prez gets 3-min standing ovation after speech to Canada's Parliament
237.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy received a three-minute standing ovation after a speech to the Canadian Parliament on Tuesday. Canadian PM Justin Trudeau led the applause after describing the Ukrainian President as a "champion for democracy". Zelenskyy had addressed the Parliament via video link and asked for more assistance in its fight with Russia, including a no-fly zone over Ukraine.

238.title: Builder arrested for cheating flat owners of ₹11 crore in Ghaziabad
238.article_body: A builder was arrested for allegedly duping 51 flat owners of ₹11 crore on pretext of providing them flats in a housing complex in Raj Nagar Extension near Ghaziabad. The accused had promised buyers of giving them possession within three years of booking their flats in 2012, a police official said. However, the project is incomplete till date, he added.

239.title: 2 held in Thane for illegally selling tickets at higher rates
239.article_body: Two persons were arrested by the Railway Protection Force (RPF) in Thane for illegally selling tickets to people at higher rates. The accused, hailing from Raboli, allegedly booked the tickets from their private IRCTC accounts and sold them to people. The police seized large number of long distance train tickets, a computer and mobile phones from the accused.

240.title: Chiranjeevi welcomes Salman on-board for Godfather, says 'It's an absolute joy'
240.article_body: Actor Salman Khan will be a part of actor Chiranjeevi's upcoming film 'Godfather'. Taking to Twitter, Chiranjeevi shared the news with his fans and followers and wrote, "Bhai...Your entry has energised everyone and the excitement has gone to the next level. Sharing the screen with you is an absolute joy. Your presence will no doubt give that magical #Kick to...audience."

241.title: Prepare to fight against dynastic politics: PM to BJP lawmakers
241.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while interacting with the BJP lawmakers asked them to prepare for a fight against dynastic politics across the country. PM Modi said not giving tickets to the kin of BJP leaders was his decision. "Agar yeh paap hai to maine yeh paap kiya hai (if this is a sin, then it's my sin)," PM Modi stated.

242.title: Colleague stabs cook after argument over how to cut cheese in Gurugram
242.article_body: A 22-year-old cook, Sourav was allegedly stabbed by a colleague after an argument over cutting cottage cheese at Gurugram restaurant. Sourav told police that he asked the accused, Vishnu, to cut cottage cheese into smaller pieces as he had sliced bigger pieces. Enraged with this, Vishnu started hurling abuses at him, when objected, he stabbed Sourav with the same knife.

243.title: NIA files chargesheet against 6 in 2021 Jalalabad bomb blast case
243.article_body: The NIA has filed a chargesheet against six people, including Khalistani operative Lakhbir Singh Rode, in connection with the bomb blast which took place in September 2021 in Punjab's Jalalabad. One person, the bomb-planter, was killed in the incident. Earlier, the gang had set ablaze a car and a few shops in Ferozepur city, said NIA.

244.title: Delhi govt orders inspection to check food adulteration ahead of Holi
244.article_body: Ahead of the festival of Holi, the food safety department of Delhi government has ordered random inspection of eateries and food businesses to check for food adulteration. The order directed the officials to especially inspect samples of sweets. Last year, about 400 people fell sick in April after eating adulterated buckwheat flour in Delhi's Kalyanpuri area.

245.title: Man suspected of shooting 5 homeless people arrested in US’ Washington
245.article_body: A 30-year-old man suspected of shooting five homeless men, killing two of them, was arrested in US' Washington. The perpetrator, identified as Gerald Brevard, has been charged with homicide, assault with a dangerous weapon and assault with intent to kill, said police. Earlier, the police released his photos and announced a reward of $55,000 for information on his whereabouts.

246.title: Entire Punjab will pledge: Kejriwal on Bhagwant Mann’s swearing-in ceremony
246.article_body: The entire Punjab will come together today and take a pledge to make a prosperous Punjab, Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal tweeted on Wednesday, ahead of the swearing-in ceremony of Punjab's CM designate Bhagwant Mann. "To witness that historic moment, I have also left for Khatkar Kalan, the native village of Shaheed Bhagat Singh," Kejriwal tweeted.

247.title: Delhi police asked to make security arrangements after 'The Kashmir..' release
247.article_body: After the release of 'The Kashmir Files', Deputy Commissioners of Police (DCPs) in Delhi have been asked to make security arrangements. "Movie is based on lives of Kashmiri Pandits...trailer purported to portray Muslims slaughtering Kashmiri Pandits...injuring community's sentiments," a letter to DCPs said, adding, "Adequate police arrangements...suggested, especially in mixed population areas."

248.title: Workers invade Luv Ranjan's film sets over non-payment of ₹1.2 crore: Reports
248.article_body: Protesting alleged non-payment of ₹1.2 crore, scores of workers invaded the sets of director-producer Luv Ranjan's upcoming film starring Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor, reports said. They reportedly claimed that around 350 people who had worked on a song for the film in October last year had not been paid the amount. Police were reportedly called on the sets.

249.title: I don't know why the Russians shot me: 9-yr-old Ukrainian girl after losing her arm
249.article_body: Sasha, a nine-year-old Ukrainian girl who lost her arm in a Russian attack, said that she doesn't know why the Russians shot her. "I hope it was an accident and that they didn't mean to hurt me," she added. Sasha's father was killed after the Russian troops opened fire on their car as they were fleeing a Kyiv suburb.

250.title: Russia's space chief, who called Musk 'little devil', invited him home 6 months ago
250.article_body: Russian space agency Roscosmos' chief Dmitry Rogozin, who called Tesla CEO Elon Musk a "little devil" after he challenged President Vladimir Putin for a single combat, praised Musk six months ago. Rogozin even invited Musk to his home in Russia in September and said he'd "already set the teakettle on heat". Rogozin wanted to discuss "exploring the universe" with Musk.

251.title: What's the point of taking pressure over price tag: GT's ₹9-crore buy Tewatia
251.article_body: All-rounder Rahul Tewatia, who was bought for ₹9 crore by Gujarat Titans, has said he's not feeling any pressure over his price tag and wants to fulfil the role for which he was bought in the auction. He added, "The team is showing belief in you and that's why they are ready to spend that kind of money on you."

252.title: Today is an important day: PM as India starts COVID vaccination of 12-14 age group
252.article_body: As India started vaccinating children aged 12 to 14 years, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Today is an important day in India's efforts to vaccinate our citizens." "Now onwards, youngsters in the 12-14 age group are eligible for vaccines and all those above 60 are eligible for precaution doses. I urge people in these age groups to get vaccinated," he wrote.

253.title: Influencer whose pic was wrongly printed on wanted poster sues US police for ₹230 crore
253.article_body: A female Instagram influencer whose picture was wrongly printed on wanted poster has sued the New York City Police Department for $30 million (nearly ₹230 crore) in damages. Eva Lopez said that the poster caused "emotional distress". Lopez was vacationing in Florida in 2021 when she saw the wanted poster for the first time.

254.title: Russian news editor who protested against war on state TV fined 30,000 roubles
254.article_body: The Russian woman who held a "No War" sign during live state TV news bulletin to protest against the attack on Ukraine was fined 30,000 roubles (approximately ₹21,000) by a court. She was held guilty of flouting protest legislation. Marina Ovsyannikova, a mother of two, had pleaded not guilty and was released after she paid the fine.

255.title: Five dead, 17 injured in road accident in Chhattisgarh
255.article_body: Five people died and 17 were injured after a tractor-trolley collided with a truck in Gariaband district of Chhattisgarh on Tuesday, police said. All the victims belonging to Majarkatta were returning from a function in Mohlai. An ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for families of the deceased and ₹50,000 each for the injured was announced by Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel.

256.title: Peace talks with Russia sounding more realistic: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
256.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that the peace talks with Russia are beginning to "sound more realistic" after nearly three weeks of the war. "However, time is still needed for the decisions to be in the interests of Ukraine," he said in a Facebook address. The talks, which are being held via video conference, are due to continue on Wednesday.

257.title: PM talks like Atal Bihari Vajpayee but doesn't act like him: Shashi Tharoor
257.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said PM Narendra Modi, at times, displayed certain traits of former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee by saying the right things but the difference is that those right words have not translated into actions. "If only he can start implementing some of the thoughts that he has said publicly, he might serve the country better," Tharoor added.

258.title: Vadodara constable's wife allegedly dies by suicide, family alleges torture
258.article_body: Vadodara Police has launched a probe after alleged suicide of a constable's 25-year-old wife. The family of deceased, Ankita Aparthy, has alleged domestic violence and mental torture in the case. "My sister was being mentally harassed for several months. She had been complaining to us and has been murdered...Her husband has not even come to meet us," Ankita's brother said.

259.title: Navjot Singh Sidhu resigns as Punjab Congress chief
259.article_body: Navjot Singh Sidhu has resigned as the Punjab Congress chief. This comes after Congress President Sonia Gandhi asked the state heads of Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Goa and Manipur to resign from their posts to reorganise the Pradesh Congress Committees. "As desired by the Congress President I have sent my resignation," Sidhu tweeted.

260.title: Muslims shouldn't think this judgement is against them: Assam CM on hijab verdict
260.article_body: After the Karnataka High Court upheld the ban on hijab in educational institutions, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that the court's judgement is logical. "Schools/colleges should have a uniform dress code. Muslims should not think that this judgement is against them," Sarma added. "This judgement is in the right step towards implementing the diktat of the Quran," Sarma stated.

261.title: I don't even know what insecurity is: Akshay on being compared to other actors
261.article_body: Speaking about being compared to other actors, Akshay Kumar said that he doesn't even know what "insecurity" is. He added that when he entered Bollywood it was a huge thing for him to just get to look at his poster. "It was a [big] deal for me to just be able to work with someone like Sanjay Dutt," Akshay said.

262.title: 45-yr-old man killed in hit and run accident in Chandigarh
262.article_body: A 45-year-old petrol pump employee died in a hit and run accident after he was mowed down by an unknown vehicle near Matka Chowk, Chandigarh, on Tuesday morning. The man was heading towards Press Light point from Matka Chowk on his two-wheeler at around 7:45 am when a rashly driven vehicle ran over him, according to the police.

263.title: Absconding don’s illegally constructed properties demolished in Meerut
263.article_body: Six shops and a factory “illegally constructed” in a government park in Meerut’s Transport Nagar area were demolished by the local district administration on Tuesday, officials said.  Police said they were constructed by local don Badan Singh alias Baddo, who later sold it to others. Baddo is wanted in several cases and is carrying a reward of ₹2.5 lakh.

264.title: Elon Musk changes his Twitter name to 'Elona' as Putin's ally calls him effeminate
264.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk changed his Twitter name to 'Elona' after Russian President Vladimir Putin's ally and the Chechen Republic's head Ramzan Kadyrov mocked him as "effeminate". Kadyrov said, "Don't measure your strength against that of Putin's." "You'll need to pump up those muscles...to change from the gentle (effeminate) Elona into the brutal Elon you need to be," he added.

265.title: Don't really understand the point of this: Neesham on new 'catch out' rule for batters
265.article_body: Reacting to MCC's new rule that new batters will face next delivery after a player is given out caught even if batters have crossed before catch is taken, New Zealand's Jimmy Neesham tweeted, "I don’t really understand the point of this." He added, "Has this rule ever been a problem? Also rewards batsmen who don't stay aware of match situation."

266.title: Sensex jumps 900 points in early trade, Nifty above 16,900
266.article_body: The Indian benchmark indices opened higher on Wednesday amid positive global cues. In early trade, the Sensex jumped more than 900 points to trade near 56,700 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped around 250 points to trade above 16,900 levels. Banks and financials, including IndusInd Bank and Axis Bank, were among top Sensex gainers.

267.title: Bad phase began after heartbreak with Amy, I disappeared completely: Prateik
267.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar said "bad phase" in his life began after he had a heartbreak with his 'Ekk Deewana Tha' co-star Amy Jackson. "I fell in love with that woman (Amy)...it just went haywire...Heartbreak at 25 years old hits different...Then I completely disappeared," he added. Amy and Prateik reportedly dated each other in 2012 but broke up soon after.

268.title: India buying discounted crude oil from Russia does not violate US sanctions: US
268.article_body: India taking up Russia's offer of discounted crude oil would not be a violation of US sanctions, the White House has said. "Our message to any country continues to be that abide by the sanctions that we have put in place and recommended," White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki told reporters at a press briefing on Tuesday.

269.title: It's not over yet: Babar on his century while chasing Aus' 506-run target
269.article_body: Chasing a 506-run target, Pakistan ended Day 4 at 192/2, needing 314 runs to win the second Test against Australia. Reacting to it, captain Babar Azam, who's unbeaten at 102, said the match is not over yet. "We need to continue playing in the same way," he added. Babar and Abdullah Shafique have added 171 runs for the third wicket.

270.title: Contamination due to cracks in old pipeline led to diarrhoea outbreak in Guj
270.article_body: Cracks in the 40-year-old pipeline that supplies drinking water to the Kalol municipality in Gujarat led to its contamination causing diarrhoea outbreak in the area, State Health and Family Welfare Minister Nimishaben Suthar said on Tuesday. An eight-month-old infant has died and 554 residents have complained of vomiting and diarrhoea with 93 hospitalisations in Kalol since March 6.

271.title: Three men arrested for raping woman in J&K's Poonch
271.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police arrested three men for allegedly raping and threatening a woman with death in Jammu & Kashmir's Poonch. The woman in her complaint alleged that an acquaintance of hers called her to his place to discuss marriage and took her to an abandoned house. He then called two of his neighbours there and raped her, she claimed.

272.title: India reports 2,876 COVID-19 cases, 3,884 recoveries in the 24 hours
272.article_body: India has reported 2,876 new COVID-19 cases, 3,884 recoveries, and 98 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 2,568 cases and 97 deaths. The COVID-19 death toll in the country has risen to 5,16,072, while the active caseload declined to 32,811.

273.title: It'll be support for invasion: US on if India buys discounted crude oil from Russia
273.article_body: On being asked about possibility that India could take up Russian offer of discounted crude oil, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said, "Think where you want to stand when history books are written in this moment in time." "Support for Russian leadership is support for invasion that is having a devastating impact," she further said.

274.title: Tripura govt hikes wage of tea garden workers by ₹31
274.article_body: Tripura CM Biplab Deb on Tuesday announced a hike in the wages of the tea garden workers in the state by ₹31. The wages will be increased from the existing ₹105 to ₹136 under the 'Mukhyamantri Cha Shramik Kalyan Prakalp' scheme. "Over 7,000 families dependent on 54 tea estates spread across Tripura are going to benefit directly," said Deb.

275.title: Hijab verdict disappointing, can be widely misused: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind
275.article_body: Calling Karnataka High Court's verdict upholding hijab ban "deeply disappointing", Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind has said that the decision will have "a direct impact on religious freedom" and affect education of Muslim girls. It said that the verdict could be misused in other contexts. "Using this verdict as a precedent, any religious practice can be called into question," said an official.

276.title: It won't matter if you don't give Akshay food, but give him work: Farhad
276.article_body: Filmmaker Farhad Samji, who has directed Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Bachchhan Paandey', said, "It won't matter if you don't give Akshay food but give him work. He even wakes up with the dedication that 'I want to work'." "I have seen this side of Akshay sir where if somebody did not get their payment someday, he would give them money," added Farhad.

277.title: Manchester United knocked out of Champions League by Atletico
277.article_body: Manchester United have been knocked out of the Champions League after their 0-1 defeat against Atletico Madrid on Tuesday night in the second leg of the round of 16. Atletico advanced 2-1 on aggregate after a draw in the first leg last month. Meanwhile, Benfica have also advanced to the quarterfinals with a 3-2 aggregate in the last-16 against Ajax.

278.title: Circuit was a stupid role; did Munna Bhai because of Sanjay Dutt: Arshad
278.article_body: Arshad Warsi said it's important for him to know who's the lead actor of the movie, before signing a film. "I did 'Munna Bhai M.B.B.S.' because it was Sanju (Sanjay Dutt), otherwise even Raju (filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani) knows that it's a stupid role," he added. "It really is on paper...Even (actor) Makrand Deshpande had said no to 'Circuit'," Arshad said.

279.title: Ex-Meta employees' crypto startup turns unicorn with $200 mn funding
279.article_body: Former Meta employees' cryptocurrency startup Aptos has turned unicorn after raising $200 million led by Andreessen Horowitz (a16z). Others who participated in the funding include Tiger Global, Katie Haun, Multicoin Capital, Three Arrows Capital, FTX Ventures and Coinbase Ventures among others. Aptos CEO Mo Shaikh and CTO Avery Ching had left Meta in December.

280.title: Women's panel seeks report from Pune police over stabbing of class 10 girl
280.article_body: The Maharashtra State Commission for Women has sought a report from Pune City Police on the knife attack on a class 10 girl by a 21-year-old man at her school farewell in Pune on Monday. The accused, who's suspected of stalking the 15-year-old girl and making one-sided advances, allegedly attempted suicide by consuming a poisonous substance after stabbing the victim.

281.title: 2 Mumbai police officers suspended after theft suspect commits suicide
281.article_body: A police sub-inspector and constable of the MHB Colony were suspended by the Commissioner for allegedly delaying the probe in a theft case leading to the suspect's suicide. Raj Pawar had allegedly committed suicide last week after he was accused of stealing a bike. His family claimed the policemen threatened Pawar and accepted a bribe of ₹20,000 from his mother.

282.title: People used to recognise me; I used to cover face, go out with Haarsh: Bharti
282.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh said she used to cover her face while going out with husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa. "Haarsh used to ask if we can go out to have pakodas...I used to tie cloth on my face...was doing Comedy Circus...People used to recognise me," Bharti said, adding she thought she will be scolded in Punjab if someone proposed marriage in Mumbai.

283.title: Pant can become a better wicketkeeper-batter than MS Dhoni: Jaffer
283.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has said that Rishabh Pant can "definitely" become a better wicketkeeper-batter than MS Dhoni. "At such a young age, he has already played some...incredible knocks. In the coming 8-10 years...he will be more mature," stated Jaffer. Pant recently scored the fastest Test fifty by an Indian off 28 deliveries in the Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka.

284.title: Man molests 2-yr-old girl by luring her with biscuits in Pune, held
284.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a two-year-old girl in Pune's Bopkhel area after luring her with biscuits. "Parents had both gone for work and girl was alone. He offered her biscuits and took her to forested land at 12:30 pm," police said, adding that the child was found with wounds on her cheeks and hands.

285.title: Russia bans Justin Trudeau and over 300 Canadians from entering the country
285.article_body: Russia has put Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and over 300 Canadians on a 'stop list' that bans them from entering the country. The list includes Foreign Minister Melanie Joly, Defence Minister Anita Anand, and almost all MPs. The move came after Canada sanctioned several Russian officials over its invasion of Ukraine. Russia also banned US President Joe Biden's entry.

286.title: SL captain Karunaratne responds to Harsha Bhogle's tweet after over 2 years, gets trolled
286.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dimuth Karunaratne has been trolled after he responded to a congratulatory tweet by Harsha Bhogle that was posted more than two years ago. "Is everything alright?" a user tweeted. Other tweets read, "Stop using Internet Explorer" and "My brother just searched his name and replied to every tweet he found because...he thought he's just being noticed now."

287.title: 8 held for forging property papers, cheating buyers in Bengaluru
287.article_body: Bengaluru police have arrested a gang of eight, including two rowdy-sheeters, for allegedly forging property papers of sites on fabricated old stamp papers and selling them to unsuspecting buyers. The accused reportedly sold many sites worth ₹8 crore in and around Bengaluru. Police have recovered 2,130 fake stamp papers, 17 fake sub-registrar office seals, and a typewriter from the gang.

288.title: 6-yr-old girl dies as speeding car hits her on road near her house in Pune
288.article_body: A six-year-old girl died after speeding car hit her in Pune's Kunjirwadi on Sunday. Incident took place when she was on the road near her house. Police said that the car was speeding from Solapur towards Pune. Case under Sections 279, 304(a) of Indian Penal Code along with Sections 184, 132(1)(c), and 119/177 of Motor Vehicle Act has been registered.

289.title: North Korea's missile launch fails
289.article_body: North Korea fired an "unidentified projectile" on Wednesday but the launch appears to have immediately failed, South Korea's military said. Japanese media reported that North Korea had launched a possible ballistic missile, citing an unnamed defence ministry official. North Korea has so far carried out nine weapons tests this year.

290.title: DDA approves 80 hectare redevelopment plan of AIIMS Delhi
290.article_body: The Delhi Development Authority has approved redevelopment of 79.73 hectares of land for AIIMS Delhi's expansion. As part of the plan, a dedicated infectious diseases ward, 50 new operation theatres and a smart library will be built. The plan envisages 1.5 lakh sqm area for state-of-the-art research laboratories, animal facilities, and a clinical trial facility.

291.title: Squatters occupy £50 million UK mansion linked to Russian oligarch
291.article_body: A group of squatters broke into a London mansion that belongs to the family of sanctioned Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska and hung signs that read 'This property has been liberated' and 'Putin go f*** yourself'. The squatters staged a demonstration on the balcony of the £50 million (around ₹500 crore) mansion, saying they were reclaiming it for Ukrainian refugees.

292.title: Any noise meter app's data can now be used to file complaints in Mumbai
292.article_body: Noise pollution complaints in Mumbai can now be lodged based on any noise monitoring application's data, Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey said. "Citizens can download any free noise meter, take a reading of the decibel level...and lodge a complaint," he said. Pandey had earlier directed major developers to install noise cutters around construction sites in the city by March 31.

293.title: Kapil Sibal doesn't know 'ABC of Congress': Rajasthan CM Gehlot
293.article_body: Rajasthan CM and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday criticised fellow party leader Kapil Sibal's remarks on suggesting change in Congress' leadership. Reacting to it, Gehlot stated that Sibal doesn't understand "ABC of Congress", adding that it isn't expected of Sibal to make such statements. Sibal's comments came after Congress' defeat in the recently held Assembly elections in five states.

294.title: Belarus resisting attempts to drag it into Ukraine war: President
294.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko said on Tuesday that the country had intercepted a missile fired at it from Ukraine two days back, but will not engage in the conflict. Lukashenko's comments came after Ukrainian government accused Russia of staging "false flag" air attacks on Belarus from Ukraine in a bid to incite Belarus to join the war.

295.title: Bailable warrant against Shilpa's mother over ₹21 lakh loan case
295.article_body: A Mumbai court on Tuesday issued a bailable warrant against actress Shilpa Shetty's mother Sunanda in a case over alleged non-repayment of a ₹21 lakh loan. The case was filed by a businessman who claimed that Shilpa's father Surendra had borrowed the money in 2015. Earlier, a summons had been issued to Sunanda and Shilpa and her sister Shamita.

296.title: Gandhi family is heart of party workers: Maharashtra Congress chief
296.article_body: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole on Tuesday said the Gandhi family is heart of Congress workers and Rahul Gandhi will become Congress president by following due process. "Those leaders who are raising questions today should first talk about what they did when they got opportunity," he added. On Monday, Congress leader Kapil Sibal said party leadership is in cuckoo land.

297.title: Australia to lift entry ban for international cruise ships after 2 yrs
297.article_body: Australia is set to lift its entry ban for international cruise ships from April onwards, in a move aimed to further ease COVID-19 restrictions. The current ban that has been in effect since March 2020 will not be renewed beyond April 17, the Australian government has confirmed. Last month, Australia reopened its international borders to vaccinated travellers.

298.title: Was all about love but never thought about marriage: Shama Sikander
298.article_body: Actress Shama Sikander, who tied the knot with American businessman James Milliron on Monday, said she never thought about marriage. "I was all about love and I still am...but the marriage was something that was not on my (mind)," she stated. "It's because I have seen what happens in marriage and because of the condition I come from," Shama added.

299.title: Frivolous: HC dismisses PIL alleging Delhi CM has Khalistani links
299.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday refused to entertain a public interest litigation petition seeking an inquiry against Aam Aadmi Party and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, alleging that they have links with Khalistani separatists. A Division Bench of Acting Chief Justice Vipin Sanghi and Justice Navin Chawla remarked that the petition was 'completely frivolous'.

300.title: Navy man stabbed by stranger in Mumbai's Azad Maidan after argument
300.article_body: A manhunt has been launched after a 24-year-old navy man was stabbed in his ribs by an unknown person in Mumbai's Azad Maidan on Monday. The victim, Sivnath Ramniwas Singh, was confronted by the unknown person for sitting inside the ground till late which led to an argument. Singh was rushed to the hospital after police received an alert.

301.title: Leaked pic from 'Pathaan' set shows SRK's transformation with 8-pack abs
301.article_body: New pictures have emerged from the shoot of Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'Pathaan' in Spain. These show the physical transformation the actor has undergone for the movie. One of the pictures that has surfaced on social media showed him with eight-pack abs. The picture showed Shah Rukh in his long-hair look for the movie.

302.title: Daniil Medvedev smashes racquet on court, Monfils' reaction goes viral
302.article_body: World number one Daniil Medvedev smashed his racquet on the court in frustration during his Indian Wells Masters round of 32 match against Gaël Monfils. Following this, Monfils mocked Medvedev by pretending to clean up the court with towel. Medvedev lost 6-4, 3-6, 1-6. Medvedev will lose his world number one spot when the rankings will get updated on Monday.

303.title: U'khand Cong chief resigns after party's defeat in Assembly polls
303.article_body: Uttarakhand Congress chief Ganesh Godiyal resigned from his position following the party's defeat in Assembly elections, adding that he takes moral responsibility for the loss. Godiyal's resignation came after Congress chief Sonia Gandhi asked the state party heads of UP, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Manipur and Goa to step down, citing the need for reorganisation. Congress won 19 seats in Uttarakhand.

304.title: Our very own boy from Indore has arrived: KKR on Venkatesh ahead of IPL
304.article_body: KKR took to Twitter to announce the arrival of Venkatesh Iyer in their squad in Mumbai ahead of IPL 2022. "Our very own boy from Indore has arrived," wrote KKR. The Indore-born all-rounder was retained by the franchise for ₹8 crore before the IPL mega auction last month. Venkatesh had scored 370 runs from 10 matches in IPL 2021.

305.title: PSL must switch from draft to auction model to match IPL level: Shoaib Malik
305.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Shoaib Malik said if Pakistan Super League (PSL) wants to match the level of IPL then they should consider moving to auction model to attract biggest stars of the game. The league is currently following the drafting system with a set money cap. Earlier, Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Ramiz Raja proposed the new model on same lines.

306.title: 3 people jailed for 3 years over illegal leopard trade in MP
306.article_body: A special court in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur has sentenced three persons to three years in jail for illegal leopard trade. The convicts were arrested in 2020 by the State Tiger Strike Force (STSF) and leopard skin and other remains were confiscated from them, Deputy Conservator of Forests, Rajneesh Singh said. He added 44 relic bones were also seized after raids.

307.title: UP gangster Ankit Gujjar's aide arrested with guns in east Delhi
307.article_body: An associate of UP gangster Ankit Gujjar, whose death in Tihar Jail prompted a CBI probe, was arrested from northeast Delhi's Welcome area. Police said the accused, Amit Dedha, who was also associated with Rohit Chaudhary's gang, was part of an inter-state arms racket. Police said two semi-automatic pistols and 17 live cartridges, besides a stolen scooter, were recovered.

308.title: Plot to push back Muslim girls failed: Kerala Governor on hijab row
308.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan on Tuesday welcomed Karnataka High Court's decision to uphold the ban on hijab in educational institutions and said, "Conspiracy to push back young Muslim girls has fallen flat". He further added, "Hijab has been mentioned seven times in the Quran, but not in the context of dress code."

309.title: Pak court acquits President Alvi in 2014 Parliament attack case
309.article_body: Pakistan's President Arif Alvi, Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi and a few other senior leaders of the ruling Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party were acquitted in the 2014 Parliament House attack case. PM Imran Khan had already been acquitted in the case in October 2020. The incident had taken place during PTI's sit-in against the then PML-N government.

310.title: People wish journalist named Aamir Khan on actor's birthday, journalist says 'Thanks'
310.article_body: Several Twitter users wished actor Aamir Khan on his birthday on Monday by tagging the handle @thereal_aamirk, that belongs to a journalist named Aamir Khan. Reacting to this, the journalist tweeted, "Thanks for all the wishes, on the birthday of actor Aamir Khan, who is NOT on Twitter." The actor turned 57 years old on Monday.

311.title: Alia's fan distributes sanitary napkins, ration kits on her b'day
311.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's fan Deep Jaiswal along with his Team Planet Alia Bhatt distributed sanitary pads and ration kits to girls in Ranchi to celebrate the actress' 29th birthday. Deep took to Twitter to share pictures from the event, adding that they also explained the importance of menstrual hygiene. Alia replied to the tweet, writing, "Bestest gift ever!! So grateful."

312.title: K'taka HC's decision on hijab row should be welcomed: Rajnath Singh
312.article_body: After the Karnataka High Court upheld the ban on hijab in educational institutions on Tuesday, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that the decision of the HC should be "welcomed". Everyone must follow the dress code of the school or college irrespective of their religion, said Singh, while addressing a program on "Women Transforming India" in Delhi.

313.title: India had 8.22 cr taxpayers in FY20, will identify more soon: FM
313.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said India had 8,22,83,407 taxpayers in FY20 out of the total projected population of 136.30 crore (as on March 1, 2021). This includes persons who pay income tax and corporate tax. "The (tax) department seeks to bring more non-filers into the tax net by formulating region-specific strategies...for identifying potential non-filers," she added.

314.title: Fox News cameraman among 2 journalists killed while reporting in Ukraine
314.article_body: Journalists Pierre Zakrzewski and Oleksandra Kuvshynova were killed while reporting in Ukraine on Monday. Zakrzewski was a veteran Fox News cameraman and his death was confirmed by the US news network on Tuesday. Kuvshynova was a Ukrainian journalist and his death was confirmed by Anton Gerashchenko, an advisor to the Ukrainian Interior Minister.

315.title: Majority of Indian students chose to stay in Ukraine: Jaishankar
315.article_body: While talking about the repatriation of Indians from war-hit Ukraine, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said a majority of students chose to stay back as they didn't want their studies to be affected. "Some universities actively discouraged and showed reluctance to offer online courses," he said, adding that this led to nearly 18,000 students being stuck when the conflict began.

316.title: Rohit has got more grey hair since taking over captaincy, jokes Mahela Jayawardene
316.article_body: Mumbai Indians took to Twitter to share a video of Rohit Sharma joining the squad ahead of IPL 2022. In the video, Rohit can be seen meeting the support staff of the franchise. "He's got more grey hair since taking over the captaincy," Mumbai Indians head coach Mahela Jayawardene can be heard jokingly saying in the video.

317.title: Punjab AAP MLAs raid govt offices, say corrupt officials 1st target
317.article_body: Days after winning the Assembly elections, four Aam Aadmi Party MLAs of Punjab's Moga district raided various government offices, including the civil hospital and said that corrupt officials were their first target. They also met with Deputy Commissioner Harish Nair and Senior Superintendent of Police Charanjit Singh Sohal and complained about the harassment of the public in government offices.

318.title: Tesla hikes car prices in US, China for second time in a week
318.article_body: Tesla has hiked the prices of its electric vehicles in the US and China for a second time in a week. The development comes after its CEO Elon Musk highlighted that Tesla is facing significant inflationary pressure in raw materials and logistics. While Tesla's cheapest car now starts at $46,990 in US, its top-end model's price has increased to $138,990.

319.title: Man electrocuted to death in MP while talking on charging phone
319.article_body: A man died of electrocution in Madhya Pradesh's Indore while talking to his wife over a mobile phone which was reportedly connected to a charging point. According to a report, the deceased's brother ran to his room after hearing him scream and found him lying on the ground. The man was then rushed to hospital where he was declared dead.

320.title: 19-yr-old man arrested by ATS of UP Police for planning to join LeT
320.article_body: The Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) of Uttar Pradesh Police on Monday arrested a 19-year-old man for allegedly being in touch with a Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) operative and for planning to go to Pakistan for arms training. "We learnt that Haq (accused) was in touch with people from Afghanistan, Pakistan, Bangladesh through different WhatsApp groups for over Jihad," said a police officer.

321.title: 2 men kill friend over sarcastic comment in Karnataka; arrested
321.article_body: Police have arrested two men who allegedly killed their friend in Karnataka's Davanagere district earlier this month after he passed a sarcastic remark about them. The deceased had sustained serious injuries and passerby had thought it was a bike accident. However, the victim's mother later filed a complaint suspecting it to be murder, according to a report quoting SP Hanumantharaya.

322.title: Don't use Russian anti-virus Kaspersky, there's serious risk of hacking: Germany to users
322.article_body: Germany's cyber security agency warned users against using Kaspersky anti-virus software developed by Russia-based Kaspersky Lab. Germany said the software poses a serious risk of a successful hacking attack and that the company could be coerced by Russian government agents to hack IT systems abroad. Kaspersky has said it is a privately-managed company with no ties to the Russian government.

323.title: TMC MLA says 'Ek Bihari, sau bimari', BJP leader shares video
323.article_body: TMC MLA Manoranjan Bapari sparked a controversy by calling people from Bihar a disease. "If you love your mother tongue and motherland, then you have to shout...'Ek Bihari, sau bimari'," he said in a video. Sharing the video, BJP's Suvendu Adhikari asked Patna-born Shatrughan Sinha, who was named as TMC candidate for by-polls, how he felt about these comments.

324.title: Over 1,500 wildlife crimes reported in 3 years in Gujarat
324.article_body: Over 1,500 cases under Wildlife Protection Act were reported in Gujarat between July 2018 and June 2021, according to state government. Maximum cases (358) were registered in the Gir Somnath region followed by Junagadh (315), state Forest Minister Kiritsinh Rana informed on Monday. He further said that 347 fire incidents were reported from wildlife sanctuary pockets between 2019 and 2020.

325.title: I feel euphoric: Anupam on 'The Kashmir Files' box office collection
325.article_body: Talking about the domestic box office collection of his film 'The Kashmir Files', actor Anupam Kher said, "I feel euphoric...Only cinema can do that." He added that 'The Kashmir Files' will be used as a case study of how cinema and audiences have changed. The film, directed by Vivek Agnihotri, has collected ₹42.20 crore since four days of its release.

326.title: FEUOK to ban Dulquer Salmaan movies over his film's OTT release
326.article_body: The Film Exhibitors United Organisation of Kerala (FEUOK) has announced that movies featuring actor Dulquer Salmaan or made by his production house Wayfarer Films will be banned from theatres in Kerala until further notice. This comes after Dulquer's upcoming film 'Salute', which was scheduled for a theatrical release, will now be released on an OTT platform.

327.title: 5.3 lakh police posts vacant in India, over 1 lakh in UP: Govt
327.article_body: Over 5.3 lakh posts are lying vacant in various police stations in India, Minister of State for Home Affairs, Nityanand Rai informed Lok Sabha, adding that over 1 lakh posts are pending in UP. As per data by the Bureau of Police Research and Development (BPR&D), sanctioned strength of police is 26,23,225, actual strength is 20,91,488, leaving 5,31,737 posts vacant.

328.title: Kanye West is the 'Donkey of the Day': Charlamagne tha God
328.article_body: American radio host Charlamagne tha God has called rapper Kanye West 'Donkey of the Day', adding, "This is all coming from a place of love." His comment comes after Kanye has been publicly asking ex-wife Kim Kardashian to reconcile. "You just mad that Pete Davidson is with Kim Kardashian. He's done nothing to you, your ex-wife chose him," Charlamagne said.

329.title: A lot of hue & cry over remakes, audience doesn't give a damn: Amit
329.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh said there's "a lot of hue and cry" over remakes and adaptations, however, added that the audience does not care about it. "You give [the audience] a good story, convincing performances...fun, they're okay," he stated.  "If you want to make a Malayalam film into a pan Indian film, why not? It's about your intention," he added.

330.title: BR Ambedkar's statue found damaged in MP village, probe underway
330.article_body: A statue of Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar has been found damaged in Madhya Pradesh's Sehore district. According to reports, police was informed of the damage by some villagers following which additional force was deployed in the village to prevent any untoward incident. Police said they have launched a probe into the matter and a case had been registered against unidentified miscreants.

331.title: Video of Tom, Tobey & Andrew creating 'Spider-Man' meme goes viral
331.article_body: A behind-the-scenes video of Spider-Man actors Tom Holland, Tobey Maguire and Andrew Garfield recreating the three Spider-Men meme has been going viral on social media. The actors were seen together in 2021 film 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'. Tom, Tobey and Andrew can be seen laughing and joking around as a compilation of dialogues from the film plays in the background.

332.title: 2 MP workers fired after dry & wet waste mixed during trash collection
332.article_body: Two contractual employees in MP's Indore were fired after dry and wet waste was found mixed in a door-to-door garbage collecting vehicle. Municipal Commissioner Pratibha Pal terminated the workers' services while she was on inspection at Zone No 7. This comes ahead of the central team's visit to the city for assessing its cleanliness standards under Swachh Survekshan 2022.

333.title: 325 died while cleaning septic tanks in last 5 yrs: Union Minister in LS
333.article_body: Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment, Ramdas Athawale, in the Lok Sabha today informed that 325 people died while cleaning sewers and septic tanks during the last five years. The maximum number of people died in Uttar Pradesh (52). However, no death has been reported because of engaging in manual scavenging, he further said.

334.title: Thousands protest against govt in Sri Lanka amid economic crisis
334.article_body: Tens of thousands of people took part in anti-government protests in Sri Lanka's capital Colombo on Tuesday, amid one of the country's worst economic crises. The protesters accused the government of mismanaging the economy and creating a foreign exchange crisis. The crisis has led to shortages of essential items like fuel, cooking gas, milk powder and medicines.

335.title: Fire breaks out at Agra's SN Medical College, patients evacuated
335.article_body: A fire broke out at an eight-storey building of SN Medical College in UP's Agra on Tuesday following which patients were evacuated. Chief Medical Officer Dr Arun Srivastava said the fire started from the garbage in the hospital's basement. He added the incident led to a stampede-like situation as people rushed to exit the building, however, no casualties were reported.

336.title: 2 Bhopal locals arrested in Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen terrorists case
336.article_body: Two Bhopal residents were detained by Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) of Madhya Pradesh for their alleged link with four Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen (JMB) members arrested on Sunday. Police said they have been detained for interrogation for allegedly harbouring the JMB members and providing logistic support. A senior officer said they're being questioned to find out if they're aware of JMB members' motives.

337.title: 17-yr-old girl, boyfriend arrested for killing her parents in UP
337.article_body: A 17-year-old girl has been arrested along with her 20-year-old boyfriend in UP's Bijnor for killing her parents for opposing their marriage plans. The girl tried to present her father's death in his house as natural but a relative grew suspicious as her mother had also died under similar circumstances, police said. The pair admitted the crime after being detained.

338.title: 16-yr-old raped by neighbour on pretext of marriage in Guj; booked
338.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was impregnated after being allegedly raped multiple times by a man in Gujarat's Halvad town on the pretext of marriage. The accused, Jignesh Tadvi, was booked after the victim's mother lodged a complaint with the police on Sunday night. Police said that the accused is currently absconding and a search is on to find him.

339.title: Ukraine's Parliament extends martial law for a month from March 26
339.article_body: Ukrainian Parliament on Tuesday voted to extend the martial law for another 30 days from March 26. This comes after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy submitted a bill to the house late on Monday, March 14 regarding the same. Meanwhile, the UN said at least 691 civilians including 48 children were killed in Ukraine between February 24 and March 14.

340.title: ₹1-crore fine among penalties for bio-bubble breach in IPL 2022
340.article_body: In its operational rules for IPL 2022, BCCI said if a team wilfully allows a person into the bio-secure bubble to have contact with players/support staff, it could face punishment up to ₹1 crore. In case, someone misses COVID-19 test, a warning will be issued for first offence and subsequent offences will result in a fine of ₹75,000 per offence.

341.title: 3 Indians stranded in Ukraine's Kherson evacuated via Moscow: MEA
341.article_body: Three Indians stranded in Ukraine's Kherson have been evacuated via Simferopol and Moscow, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said on Tuesday. "They boarded their flight from Moscow a short while ago and the Indian Embassy in Russia has facilitated their transit and accommodation en route," said Arindam Bagchi, spokesperson of the MEA.

342.title: South Korea reports record 293 COVID-19 deaths in last 24 hours
342.article_body: South Korean authorities on Tuesday said the country reported 293 COVID-19 deaths in last 24 hours, recording the highest death toll since the pandemic began. As per Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency (KDCA), 1,196 patients were reported to be in a critical condition in the same period. Meanwhile, the country logged 3,62,338 cases on Tuesday.

343.title: No strong or weak team in T20 cricket: DC assistant coach Agarkar
343.article_body: DC assistant coach Ajit Agarkar said there's no strong or weak team in T20 cricket, adding there's enough evidence throughout the editions of IPL that no team is easy to beat. "If you see RR in...first edition of IPL, everyone was having a laugh at the team they picked in...auction, but they went on to win the trophy," he added.

344.title: More Afghans are going hungry since Taliban takeover: World Bank
344.article_body: A World Bank survey has found that the number of people in Afghanistan who cannot afford food and other essentials has doubled since the Taliban takeover of the country in August last year. The economic crisis was sparked after international donors cut financial aid to the country. Over half of Afghanistan's population faces starvation, the UN had warned.

345.title: Going to be an exciting finish: Ashwin after Babar's ton in Pak-Aus Test
345.article_body: India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin praised Pakistan captain Babar Azam for scoring a century in second innings of Pakistan-Australia second Test. "[It's] going to be an exciting finish tomorrow," he tweeted. Pakistan are 192/2 at stumps on Day 4, with Babar on 102* and Abdullah Shafique unbeaten on 71. Chasing a 506-run target, Pakistan need 314 more runs to win.

346.title: Russia bans Joe Biden, other top US officials from entering its soil
346.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry said that US President Joe Biden and other top officials have been banned from entering the country in a reciprocal response to US sanctions. The measure, which also applies to Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin, "is the consequence of the extremely Russophobic policy pursued by the current US administration," said Russia.

347.title: Paytm share price drops 71% from IPO price; out of BSE top-100 mcap list
347.article_body: Paytm shares dropped to an all-time low of ₹616.55 apiece on Tuesday, leading it to drop out of the BSE top 100-most valued companies by market capitalisation.
