Following RBI's order on Paytm Payments Bank, its shares crashed 20% in the last two trading sessions. Notably, its share price has dropped 71% from its issue price of ₹2,150 apiece.

348.title: Amazon's demand for $200 mn caused Amazon-Future settlement talks to fail: Report
348.article_body: The dispute settlement talks between Amazon and India's Future Retail failed over the US company's demand for the return of at least $200 million it had invested in Future, Reuters reported. Future instead offered a stake of an equivalent amount in one of its remaining group companies after Reliance takes over most of its retail assets. Amazon didn't accept that.

349.title: Bobby was nervous about speaking Haryanvi in 'Love Hostel': Shanker
349.article_body: 'Love Hostel' director Shanker Raman revealed Bobby Deol was nervous about speaking Haryanvi in the film. Shanker said Bobby started working on it a month before the film's shooting began and added the actor completely surrendered himself. "We would have dinner on location...he would just say his lines to me, like a child, happy to have learned them," Shanker stated.

350.title: SoftBank's Munish Varma steps down from Paytm, PolicyBazaar boards
350.article_body: Paytm on Tuesday informed stock exchanges that Munish Varma, Managing Partner at SoftBank Investment Advisers, has resigned from Paytm's board "due to personal commitments and other pre-occupations". He has also resigned from Policybazaar's board. Varma's resignation is consistent with Softbank's move globally, as it steps away from board positions after its portfolio companies get listed.

351.title: Better to touch it than never being world no. 1: Daniil on losing top spot
351.article_body: Daniil Medvedev, who will lose his world number one ranking to Novak Djokovic on Monday, said it's better to be number one for "one week in life" than to never "touch" it. Medvedev claimed the top spot on February 28. The Russian lost the ranking after losing to Frenchman Gael Monfils in Indian Wells Masters third round on Monday.

352.title: Will be with family for a while: Sandra on taking break from acting
352.article_body: Actress Sandra Bullock said she will be taking a break from acting "for a while" to focus on her family. Adding that it's 24/7 work, Sandra said that she takes her job as an actor very seriously when she's at work. "I just want to be 24/7 with my babies..my family...That's where I'm gonna be for a while," she added.

353.title: Pakistan logs 473 new COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths in last 24 hours
353.article_body: Pakistani authorities on Tuesday said the country reported 473 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours. As per Pakistan's National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC), 4 new deaths were recorded taking total death toll to 30,313. NCOC added that out of 18,026 active cases, 560 patients were critical. Meanwhile, positivity rate has dropped to 1.37% from 1.48%.

354.title: Myanmar's military has committed crimes against humanity: UN
354.article_body: Myanmar's military has committed war crimes and crimes against humanity since it took power in a coup, the UN said. Security forces have shown a flagrant disregard for human life, the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, Michelle Bachelet, said. Many victims were shot in the head, burned to death, arrested arbitrarily, tortured, or used as human shields, she added.

355.title: Frankfurt Airport cancels 130 flights amid strike by security staff
355.article_body: Authorities at Germany's Frankfurt Airport cancelled 130 out of 818 flights on Tuesday as airport's cargo and passenger control employees went on strike. This comes amid wage dispute between Verdi trade union and Federal Association of Aviation Security Companies (BDLS). While trade union raised host of demands including an hourly raise of at least €1, BDLS has refused to comply.

356.title: BJP-BSP had tacit understanding on 122 seats in UP polls: SBSP chief
356.article_body: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) founder OP Rajbhar on Tuesday claimed that the BJP and Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) had a tacit understanding on 122 Assembly seats in UP. "122 seats in Purvanchal are such on which candidates were decided at BJP office and symbols were given at BSP office. I can provide evidence for the same," he alleged.

357.title: In worst debt of my life, anyone else in my place would've died by suicide: Kaaranvir
357.article_body: TV actor Kaaranvir Bohra has said that he is currently under "the worst debt" of his life, adding, "I have at least three-four cases on me for not paying the money back." He added, "Since 2015, whatever work I accept is to pay off the debt...Had anyone else been in my position, he would've died by suicide," said Bohra.

358.title: Meta fined $19 million by Ireland over a series of data breaches
358.article_body: Irish watchdog has imposed €17 million ($19 million) fine on Meta Platforms for failing to prevent a series of 12 personal data breaches on Facebook in 2018. "We found that Meta Platforms failed to have in place appropriate technical and organisational measures," the Data Protection Commission (DPC) said. "This fine isn't about a failure to protect people's information," Meta said.

359.title: Delhi Metro to start services after 2.30 pm on Holi, buses to run after 2 pm
359.article_body: Delhi Metro services won't be available till 2:30 pm on all lines, including the Airport Express Line, on Holi this Friday, the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) said. Services will start at 2:30 pm from terminal stations on all lines and will continue normally thereafter, it added. DTC bus services will also start after 2 pm on Holi.

360.title: Ukraine realises it can't join NATO, says President Zelenskyy
360.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said the country realises that it can't join NATO. Speaking  to representatives of the UK-led Joint Expeditionary Force (JEF), Zelenskyy said that "we heard for years about the allegedly open doors" of NATO, but "we have already heard that we won't be able to join". He added that "it's the truth we must recognise".

361.title: Whenever I DM him, I get a reply: Pune engineer who is Twitter friends with Musk
361.article_body: A 23-year-old engineer from Pune, who is Twitter friends with the world's richest man Elon Musk said that they converse on various subjects and Musk is very "straightforward". Pranay Pathole added, "He's super friendly. It doesn't feel like you are interacting with the world's richest person...He's very active on Twitter...because whenever I DM him, I get a reply within...minutes."

362.title: Udupi schools & colleges to reopen tomorrow, section 144 to continue
362.article_body: Schools and colleges in Karnataka's Udupi will reopen on Wednesday after being shut on Tuesday in view of the HC's judgment on the hijab ban issue. However, prohibitory orders imposed under CrPC section 144 will continue till March 21, banning processions, celebrations and protests, the Deputy Commissioner said. The HC upheld the ban on wearing hijab in state's educational institutions.

363.title: 2,000 civilian cars left besieged Mariupol: Ukrainian officials
363.article_body: Around 2,000 civilian cars have been able to leave the besieged Ukrainian city of Mariupol along a humanitarian evacuation route, the city council said on Tuesday. A further 2,000 vehicles were waiting to leave the city, it added. The Russian forces have blockaded and bombarded Mariupol, with supplies in the city running low.

364.title: K'taka hijab case petitioners vow to attend classes only in hijab
364.article_body: Girls who are seeking permission to wear hijab inside educational institutions vowed to "fight for justice and [their] rights" and attend classes only in hijab. "The Constitution itself provides us (our rights) to follow my religion and wear whatever we want," one of the girls said. Karnataka HC today held prescription of uniform as a reasonable restriction.

365.title: Oppn's lack of cooperation led to BJP's win in Assembly polls: Alagiri
365.article_body: Tamil Nadu Congress Committee (TNCC) chief KS Alagiri on Monday said the BJP won Assembly polls in four states due to lack of cooperation among opposition parties. "To defeat...BJP and PM Modi [in 2024 Lok Sabha elections] opposition...should start working together from today," he added. Alagiri added that Congress cadres across the country want Rahul Gandhi to lead the party.

366.title: Man fakes religious identity, rapes 19-yr-old & films act in J'khand
366.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested on the charge of raping a 19-year-old a month back and for filming the act to blackmail her in Jharkhand's Ramgarh district, a police officer said on Tuesday. The victim, in her complaint, said that the accused had allegedly faked his religious identity and befriended her some time ago.

367.title: Woman who held 'No war' poster on Russian TV on trial, faces 10 days in prison
367.article_body: Marina Ovsyannikova, the woman who interrupted a live news bulletin on Russian state TV channel with a 'No war' poster, is on trial and faces ten days in prison, said AFP. She was detained after she ran on to set holding the sign. Meanwhile, French President Emmanuel Macron said he'd discuss offering protection for her with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin.

368.title: MEA did commendable job: Cong MP on evacuation from war-hit Ukraine
368.article_body: Congress MP Anand Sharma praised the Ministry of External Affairs for evacuating Indians from war-hit Ukraine. "Work done by the MEA, diplomats, and Indian Missions abroad is commendable," he said. He also narrated an incident regarding one student and said he contacted Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla at 1:00 am for help and received a response at 1:22 am.

369.title: His 1st reply was my life's highlight: Pune engineer on being Twitter friends with Musk
369.article_body: A 23-year-old Pune engineer revealed how he became friends with world's richest man and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Twitter. In 2018, then 2nd year engineering student Pranay Pathole tweeted to Musk about Tesla's automatic screen wipers, to which Musk responded instantly. Adding that their interactions are casual now, Pathole said Musk's first response was the "highlight" of his life.

370.title: Australian govt’s 'Women’s Network' withdraws logo over criticism
370.article_body: Women's Network, a volunteer-based collective in the Australian Prime Minister's department, has withdrawn its logo after receiving criticism over it. The logo consisted of a cursive W with a domed protrusion, giving it an apparent resemblance to male genitalia. The group clarified that the "Prime Minister's office wasn't part of this logo design".

371.title: Expect to evacuate our citizens from Ukraine's Mariupol soon: Turkey
371.article_body: Turkey's Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu said on Tuesday that the country expects to evacuate its citizens from Ukraine's Mariupol soon. He added that 14,800 Turkish citizens had been evacuated from Ukraine so far amid the Russian invasion. Çavuşoğlu's comments came after Russian forces attacked a mosque in Mariupol last week where over 80 people, including Turkish citizens, had sought refuge.

372.title: ₹7.34 lakh crore recovered by banks since FY16: MoS Finance
372.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad on Tuesday said banks have recovered ₹7,34,542 crore in the last six financial years and in the first six months of FY22. This includes recoveries in cases of non-performing assets and written-off loan accounts. He added that systematic and comprehensive checking led to unearthing of frauds perpetrated over the years.

373.title: India's urban unemployment rate jumped to 12.6% in Apr-Jun 2021 amid 2nd wave
373.article_body: India's urban unemployment rate jumped to 12.6% in April-June 2021 from 9.3% in the previous quarter amid COVID-19's second wave, according to data released by the government. The rise in unemployment in the second quarter of 2021 was the first such increase since the jobless rate peaked at 20.8% in April-June 2020, the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation said.

374.title: Beating Federer at 2014 Davis Cup final was a big moment: Monfils
374.article_body: World number 28 Gael Monfils said that defeating 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer at Davis Cup final in 2014 was a "big moment" for him. "It was an important match," he added. Monfils beat Federer in second match and levelled the tie 1-1. However, Switzerland won the next two matches to win their first-ever Davis Cup title.

375.title: Marshals, throw him out: Rajasthan Speaker evicts MLA from Assembly
375.article_body: Rajasthan MLA Sanyam Lodha was evicted from state Assembly by Speaker CP Joshi on Tuesday after he disrupted proceedings of the House. "Marshals, throw him out. I'll not allow it," Joshi ordered. Lodha, who was demanding the release of a man jailed for four years on a murder charge, entered the Well of the House and raised slogans against police.

376.title: Didn't realise I was pregnant for 2.5 months: Comedian Bharti Singh
376.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh said she didn't realise that she was pregnant for the first two and a half months. She jokingly added, "Mote logo ka pata nahi chalta." Bharti revealed she and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa were surprised when they found out about the pregnancy. "We didn't plan that this is the right time to have a baby," she stated.

377.title: Swara Bhasker indirectly targets 'The Kashmir Files' in her tweet, Twitter users react
377.article_body: Swara Bhasker's tweet, wherein she seemed to indirectly speak about Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files', sparked reactions on Twitter. "People are asking why prominent Bollywood stars haven't said a word of appreciation for getting people back in cinemas. Operative word being 'prominent'," a comment read. Another Twitter user agreed to her tweet and commented, "Well said."

378.title: Cong heads of 5 states asked to resign post-Assembly poll defeat
378.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday asked the party's state heads of Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Goa and Manipur to resign from their posts. This is being done to reorganise the Pradesh Congress Committees of these states. Congress won only two of 403 seats in UP, 19 of 70 seats in Uttarakhand and 18 of 117 seats in Punjab.

379.title: Alibaba, Tencent lose over $1 trillion in market value over a year
379.article_body: Chinese technology giants Alibaba and Tencent have lost more than $1 trillion in combined market value over the last 13 months. The stocks of Chinese tech companies plunged over the past year as the government extended its regulatory crackdown. While food delivery platform Meituan's market value has plunged by $254.6 billion since February 2021, e-commerce platform Pinduoduo lost $217.6 billion.

380.title: Unseen hands at work to engineer unrest: K'taka HC on hijab case
380.article_body: As it passed the verdict on the hijab controversy on Tuesday, a three-judge bench of the Karnataka High Court commented that some "unseen hands are at work to engineer social unrest and disharmony". "We are dismayed as to how all of a sudden...the issue of hijab is generated and blown out of proportion by the powers that be," HC said.

381.title: Actor Puneeth's elder brothers break down at 'James' event
381.article_body: Puneeth Rajkumar's elder brothers Raghavendra Rajkumar and Shivarajkumar got emotional while remembering the late actor during an event for Puneeth's film 'James'. "I can't tolerate [Puneeth's death] anymore, I'm ready to leave," Raghavendra said. Shivarajkumar broke down listening to Raghavendra and said, "It pained me a lot to see [Raghavendra] speak like that...[Puneeth] was everyone's pet."

382.title: EU to propose 'amber' category for gas, nuclear energy investments
382.article_body: EU chief advisor Nathan Fabian on Tuesday said bloc will shortly propose a new category 'amber' for not-fully green investments such as gas, nuclear energy. This comes after Fabian had opposed including both as green investments. Notably, gas, nuclear energy play a role in transition towards green fuel as they are low-carbon but produce greenhouse gases and radioactive waste respectively.

383.title: Ukraine's region warns of air raids, urges citizens to take shelter
383.article_body: Authorities in Ukrainian region of Chernihiv on Tuesday issued a nationwide warning of air raids by Russian forces. They also urged the citizens to take shelter. However, it was not clear if other regions in the country had issued similar warnings. Meanwhile, UN said at least 636 civilians were killed in Ukraine from February 24 to March 13.

384.title: New Zealand's new policy offers visas to 4,000 Ukrainian refugees
384.article_body: New Zealand on Tuesday said that it will offer 4,000 special visas to family members of Ukrainian-New Zealanders under a new policy in a response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. It's New Zealand's largest special visa category in decades, Immigration Minister Kris Faafoi said. Nearly 30 lakh people have fled Ukraine since the invasion began in February, the UN said.

385.title: HC asks Sharad Yadav to vacate govt bungalow in Delhi in 15 days
385.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday asked former JD(U) chief Sharad Yadav to vacate the government bungalow occupied by him within 15 days as he was disqualified as Rajya Sabha MP in 2017. The court said there was no justification for Yadav to retain the bungalow. Yadav was elected to the Rajya Sabha in 2017.

386.title: Zomato loans $150 mn to Blinkit, buys 16.66% stake in Mukunda Foods for $5 mn
386.article_body: Zomato is loaning $150 million to Blinkit (formerly Grofers) as per its plan of investing $400 million cash in Indian quick commerce over the next two years. The loan's interest rate will be 12% p.a. or higher with a tenor of not more than one year. Zomato is also acquiring a 16.66% stake in Mukunda Foods for $5 million.

387.title: Deep Ocean Mission will bolster observations in Indian Ocean: Centre
387.article_body: Ministry of Earth Sciences Secretary M Ravichandran on Monday said Deep Ocean Mission will strengthen observational network in Indian Ocean. He added the system will help capture long term changes in the ocean's climatic conditions. Reportedly, eight deep ocean gliders, 48 argo floats and 150 wave drifters will be added in coming years as part of the ₹4,000 crore mission.

388.title: Over 13,500 Russian troops killed since war began: Ukraine
388.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Ministry on Tuesday said over 13,500 Russian troops were killed since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. The ministry added that 404 tanks, 81 aircraft and 95 helicopters belonging to Russian forces were destroyed so far. Meanwhile, UN said at least 636 civilians including 46 children were killed from February 24 to March 13 in Ukraine.

389.title: Amazon's ad campaign laughable, attempt to confuse Indian govt: CAIT
389.article_body: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) said it finds Amazon's claims in a paid public advertisement "sanctimonious and laughable". "They are nothing but a pathetic attempt at buying media legitimacy and confusing the Indian government...about Amazon's persistent violations of India's FDI laws," it added. The traders' body further said the contents of the public notice are mala fide.

390.title: Which states have declared the movie 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free?
390.article_body: At least eight states have declared the movie 'The Kashmir Files', which stars Anupam Kher, Mithun Chakraborty among others, as tax-free. The film, based on the 1990 exodus of Hindus from Kashmir Valley, will be tax-free in UP, Goa, Tripura, MP, Karnataka, Haryana, Gujarat and Uttarakhand. Karnataka government also said it'll screen the film in state Assembly on Tuesday.

391.title: Babar smashes Test hundred after 2 years, pulls off Suryakumar Yadav-like celebration
391.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam smashed his first Test hundred after over two years by reaching the three-figure mark in the second innings of the Karachi Test against Australia off 180 deliveries. Babar celebrated his hundred first with a roar and then pulled off a Suryakumar Yadav-like 'Keep calm, I am here' celebration while pointing towards his teammates.

392.title: Lewis Hamilton to change name to include his mother Carmen's surname
392.article_body: Seven-time Formula 1 world champion Lewis Hamilton has revealed that he will change his name to incorporate his mother Carmen's original surname, Larbalestier. "I don't really fully understand the whole idea that when people get married the woman loses her name and I really want my mum's name to continue on with the Hamilton name," he added.

393.title: Pakistan Cricket Board planning to introduce women's PSL early next year
393.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Ramiz Raja said the board is planning to introduce a Pakistan Super League (PSL) for women in January next year with foreign players. "We've to take steps to have a proper domestic calendar for women with three-day matches," he added. Meanwhile, Pakistan have lost all its opening four matches in 2022 Women's World Cup.

394.title: 3 arrested for ₹6 cr heist at Belagavi cooperative bank in K'taka
394.article_body: Belagavi Police has arrested three people, including a bank clerk, for robbing the Belagavi District Credit Cooperative Bank of cash and ornaments worth nearly ₹6 crore. Cash worth ₹4.2 crore and three kilograms of gold and silver ornaments worth ₹1,63,72,220 have been recovered. The accused have been identified as Basavraj Hunshikatti, Santosh Kalappa Kambar and Yamanappa Laxman Belwal.

395.title: Ukraine crisis shows need for reform in UNSC: Japan Foreign Minister
395.article_body: Japanese Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi said on Tuesday that Russia-Ukraine crisis has highlighted need for reforming United Nations Security Council (UNSC). Hayashi's comment comes weeks after Russia, which is a permanent member of UNSC, vetoed a draft resolution that demanded Moscow to withdraw its troops from Ukraine. US, UK, France and China are the four other permanent members of UNSC.

396.title: 15-month-old girl run over by truck outside shanty in Gr Noida
396.article_body: A 15-month-old girl child was killed on Tuesday morning after a truck ran over her outside her shanty in Greater Noida's Surajpur area. "As soon as we received the information about the incident, the police staff was rushed to the spot," an official said. A truck bearing Haryana's registration number ran the girl over, the official added.

397.title: Over 4,800 flats in Pune on list of lapsed projects in Maharashtra
397.article_body: The 407 projects that lapsed in Maharashtra in 2021 include 4,852 flats in 92 Pune housing projects of which 51% flats are sold, property consultants ANAROCK said after analysing MahaRERA data. A project is considered lapsed if developer fails to complete it on time, making it difficult for owners to mortgage or sell properties as banks won't finance the project.

398.title: B'luru records 61 new COVID cases, 0 deaths on Monday; 229 recover
398.article_body: Bengaluru recorded 61 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths on Monday. Data released by the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) revealed that 229 people were discharged or have recovered from the virus in the city in the last 24 hours. A total of 7,311 coronavirus tests were done in the city on March 14 and 8,140 vaccine doses were administered.

399.title: Ukraine's Prez asks for more weapons from European nations amid war
399.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday urged European nations to send more weapons to Ukraine to fight the Russian forces invading the country. "We all are the targets of Russia and everything will go against Europe if Ukraine won't stand," he said. "So I would like to ask you to help yourself by helping us," Zelenskyy added.

400.title: Those cutting, damaging trees to celebrate Holi to be penalised: BMC
400.article_body: BMC on Monday said action will be taken against Mumbai residents cutting or damaging trees for Holi celebrations. "If anybody is caught, that person can be imprisoned for seven days or one year and may also have to pay a penalty between ₹1,000 and ₹5,000," an official said. Civic officials will keep an eye with help of surveillance teams.
